sections.title: Hey, I'm Aaryan ðŸ‘‹
content: I'm a third-year Computer Engineering student who got tired of building the same old projects. You know the drill - another todo app, another chat clone, another portfolio that looks like everyone else's.

When I started diving into the modern AI stack - Vercel AI SDK, RAG systems, vector databases, LangGraph, and MCPs - I realized something: most student projects just scratch the surface. They build a ChatGPT clone, call it a day, and move on.
I wanted to do something different. Something that would actually showcase what I'm learning.

sections.title: The Challenge
content: How do you build a project that demonstrates expertise in RAG, agentic workflows, tool orchestration, and full-stack development - without just making another chatbot clone?

The answer hit me: instead of building a narrow AI assistant, why not build a Swiss Army knife? A platform that shows I can integrate 27+ different tools, orchestrate complex agent workflows, and build production-ready infrastructure.

sections.title: What I Built
content: Swiss Army Knife AI is my answer to the 'just another clone' problem. It's a RAG-powered chatbot that goes way beyond document Q&A.

I integrated LangGraph.js for agentic workflows, built 11+ MCP servers for tool connectivity, implemented vector similarity search with Neon Postgres, and created an interface where AI agents can autonomously orchestrate across Gmail, Calendar, Slack, and Drive.
This isn't just a project - it's proof of concept. Proof that I can build complex, production-ready systems. Proof that I understand modern AI infrastructure from the ground up.

sections.title: Open Source & Community
content: Here's the thing - I've built the foundation with 27 tools and 2 agentic workflows, but this project is far from done.
I'm planning to add 2-3 more agents myself, but beyond that, I want this to be a community-driven project. There are hundreds of potential tools, workflows, and integrations that could be added.
Whether you want to contribute a new MCP server, add a utility tool, or build a complex agent workflow - this project is open for contributions. Let's build something bigger together.

technologies.name: RAG & Vector Databases
technologies.description: Built semantic search with pgvector, implemented document chunking strategies, and optimized retrieval for multi-document queries

technologies.name: Agentic Workflows
technologies.description: Designed complex multi-step agent workflows using LangGraph.js, with decision-making, tool orchestration, and error handling

technologies.name: Model Context Protocol
technologies.description: Created 11+ MCP servers for tool integration, from YouTube transcripts to Gmail automation

technologies.name: Full-Stack TypeScript
technologies.description: End-to-end type safety with Next.js, Drizzle ORM, and Vercel AI SDK - no Python backend needed

technologies.name: API Integrations
technologies.description: Integrated with 15+ external APIs - from Google Workspace to social media platforms

sections.title: Why This Matters
content: As a student, I needed more than just academic projects on my resume. I needed something that showed I could build real-world systems.
â€¢ System design - architecting a multi-agent platform from scratch
â€¢ Production skills - database design, API integration, auth, deployment
â€¢ Modern AI stack - hands-on experience with cutting-edge tools
â€¢ Open source leadership - building something others can contribute to
It's not just about the code - it's about showing I can take complex technologies and turn them into something useful.

personalNote.title: A Note on Learning
personalNote.content: This project taught me something important: the best way to learn isn't to follow tutorials or build toy apps. It's to set an ambitious goal and figure out how to make it work. Every feature here forced me to read docs, debug weird errors, and understand concepts at a deeper level. That's the kind of learning that sticks.
